intro: Coreopsis guanajuatensis, commonly known as the Guanajuato coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to central Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and the flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in open woodlands and along rocky slopes in its native habitat.
